title: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
snippets: The FSB say they detained a "Ukrainian special services agent". Kyiv has not commented on the attack.
titles: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
summary: The FSB has reported the detention of an individual claimed to be an agent of the Ukrainian special services. As of now, there has been no official response or comment from Kyiv regarding the incident.

title: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
snippets: At least four people have been killed and 500 more injured in Bandar Abbas.
titles: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
summary: At least four individuals lost their lives, and over 500 were injured in an incident in Bandar Abbas. The current status of the situation or the cause of the incident has not been specified in the provided information.

title: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
snippets: Entire Strip, with a population of two million people, may be on the brink of famine as WFP runs out of supplies.
titles: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
summary: The Strip, home to two million residents, faces a potential famine crisis due to the World Food Programme (WFP) depleting its supplies. This situation puts the population at significant risk of food scarcity.

title: Trump questions Putin's desire for peace after meeting Zelensky at the Vatican
snippets: The US president said he feared the Russian leader was "tapping me along" given Moscow's strikes on Kyiv earlier this week.
titles: Trump questions Putin's desire for peace after meeting Zelensky at the Vatican
summary: The US President expressed concern that the Russian leader is misleading or delaying him, especially in light of Moscow's recent attacks on Kyiv. This statement reflects the President's apprehension about Russia's intentions and actions.

snippets: Hussein al-Sheikh is a veteran leader of Abbas's Fatah movement.
titles: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas appoints aide as PLO deputy
summary: Hussein al-Sheikh is an experienced leader within the Fatah movement, which is headed by Mahmoud Abbas.

snippets: Pittsburgh adds a QB in Day 3

summary: The Pittsburgh Steelers selected a quarterback during Day 3 of the NFL Draft. This move aims to strengthen their quarterback roster. The addition of a new quarterback is part of the team's ongoing efforts to enhance their offensive lineup.

title: NFL Draft Guru Mel Kiper Goes On Viral Rant Against Shedeur Slide
snippets: After the Cleveland Browns finally drafted Shedeur Sanders in the fifth round, NFL Draft guru Mel Kiper went on a viral rant against the league's quarterback evaluations.
titles: NFL Draft Guru Mel Kiper Goes On Viral Rant Against Shedeur Slide
summary: After Shedeur Sanders was selected by the Cleveland Browns in the fifth round of the NFL Draft, Mel Kiper, a prominent draft analyst, publicly criticized the league's method of evaluating quarterbacks in a rant that gained widespread attention online.

title: Saturday's Mets-Nationals game delayed due to rain
snippets: The start of Saturday afternoon's game between the Mets and Nationals at Nationals Park will be delayed due to the threat of rain.
titles: Saturday's Mets-Nationals game delayed due to rain
summary: The start of the baseball game scheduled for Saturday afternoon at Nationals Park between the Mets and Nationals has been postponed due to anticipated rain.

title: NFL Draft 2025: How many Georgia players do Eagles have on defense now after selection of Smael Mondon Jr.?
snippets: Mondon is the latest Georgia player on the Philly defense
titles: NFL Draft 2025: How many Georgia players do Eagles have on defense now after selection of Smael Mondon Jr.?
summary: Smael Mondon, a player from Georgia, has recently joined the Philadelphia Eagles' defense. This move adds to the growing list of Georgia players on the team, indicating a strategic choice by the Eagles to incorporate talent from this specific college program.

title: Social media reactions to Notre Dame QB Riley Leonard staying in Indiana with the Colts

title: China seizes disputed reef in the South China Sea
snippets: Sandy Cay is just kilometres from the Philippines’ military outpost at Thitu Island
titles: China seizes disputed reef in the South China Sea
summary: Sandy Cay, located only a few kilometers away from Thitu Island, is in proximity to a military outpost maintained by the Philippines.

title: Kremlin claims to have pushed Ukraine out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin
snippets: Russia acknowledges presence of North Korean troops on the ground for the first time
titles: Kremlin claims to have pushed Ukraine out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin
summary: For the first time, Russia has officially acknowledged the presence of North Korean troops on the ground. This marks a significant development, as it is the initial confirmation of North Korean military personnel's involvement in the region. The implications of this acknowledgment are yet to be fully understood, but it signifies a notable shift in the dynamics of regional military presence.

title: Trump and Zelenskyy hold ‘productive’ discussion at Pope’s funeral
snippets: World leaders gathered in Rome as US and Ukrainian presidents met for first time since Oval Office row
titles: Trump and Zelenskyy hold ‘productive’ discussion at Pope’s funeral
summary: World leaders convened in Rome, marking the first meeting between the US and Ukrainian presidents since a disagreement in the Oval Office. This gathering underscores ongoing diplomatic engagements between the two nations.

title: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
snippets: Proposal to fold the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board into the SEC will boost Donald Trump’s deregulatory agenda
titles: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
summary: A proposal has been made to integrate the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) into the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This move is seen as a step towards advancing former President Donald Trump's agenda to reduce regulatory burdens.

title: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
snippets: Move by employees at Google’s AI arm follows discontent after weapons and surveillance pledge is dropped
titles: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
summary: Employees at Google's AI division have expressed discontent and taken action following the company's decision to abandon a pledge against using its technology for weapons and surveillance purposes. This move highlights a significant shift in Google's ethical stance on the application of its artificial intelligence technology.
